raw_mentions: In certain embodiments, an antibody that binds to STEAP-1 has a dissociation constant (Kd) of < 1 μΜ, < 100 nM, < 10 nM, < 1 nM, < 0.1 nM, < 0.01 nM, or < 0.001 nM (e.g. 10^"8 M or less, e.g. from 10^"8 M to 10^~13 M, e.g. , from 10^"9 M to 10^~13 M).

Here are the extracted sentences that meet the criteria:

[00112] In certain embodiments, the antibodies provided herein has a dissociation constant (Kd) to STEAP-1 of≤ 1000 nM,≤ 100 nM,≤ 10 nM,≤ 1 nM,≤ 0.1 nM,≤ 0.01 nM, or≤ 0.001 nM (e.g. 10^"8 M or less, e.g. from 10^"8 M to 10^"13 M, e.g. , from 10^"9 M to 10^"13 M).
[00114] According to another embodiment, Kd is measured using surface plasmon resonance assays using a BIACORE^-2000 or a BIACORE^-3000 (BIAcore, Inc., Piscataway, NJ) at 25°C with immobilized antigen CM5 chips at -10 response units (RU).
For kinetics measurements, two-fold serial dilutions of Fab (0.78 nM to 500 nM) are injected in PBS with 0.05% polysorbate 20 (TWEEN-20^) surfactant (PBST) at 25°C at a flow rate of 
[00115] Kinetic binding measurements can also be performed on an Octet Red instrument (ForteBio, Menlo Park, CA, USA). For example, all washes, dilutions and measurements are performed in Octet buffer (0.2% dodecyimaltoside, or DDM, - PBS) with the plate shaking at 1000 rpm. Streptavidin biosensors are equilibrated in Octet buffer for 10 min and then loaded with biotinylated STEAP-1 (from viral iysate in 1 % DDM, diluted 1 :8 in Octet Buffer) for 5 min and washed for 10 min. For the association phase, the ligand-coated streptavidin tips are immersed in anti-STEAP-1 antibody fragments for 10 min (eight serial two-fold dilutions, starting at 500 or 50 nM).
